TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SaveEventArgs extends System.EventArgs
Public MustInherit Class SaveEventArgs Inherits EventArgs
public ref class SaveEventArgs abstract : EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of a form.

remarks.para: The SaveEventArgs object provides properties and methods that can be used during a save operation from an event handler for the Save event to determine save properties, and perform the save operation.

The properties provided by the SaveEventArgs object are available only during the Save event. This object is destroyed when the form's Save event expires so it may not be stored and used outside of the scope of the Save event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property CancelableArgs As SaveCancelEventArgs

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the object that can be used to cancel the event.

remarks.para: Access the SaveCancelEventArgs object to cancel the Save event and specify a custom message to display when the event is cancelled.
The SaveEventArgs.CancelableArgs.Cancel property is set to true by default.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Filename As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ Filename { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the file name to be used in the event handler for the event.
Docs.value: The name of the file to be saved.

remarks.para: If the property of the object is true, and a save operation has not yet occurred, the FileName property returns an empty string. If the IsSaveAs property is true and a save operation has already occurred, the value returned by the FileName property is the file name under which the form was saved. If the IsSaveAs property is false, the FileName property returns the same value as the property of the object.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsSaveAs As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsSaveAs { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether the method will be performed as a "save" operation or as a "save as" operation.
Docs.value: true if the PerformSaveOperation method will be performed as a "save as" operation; false if the method will be performed as a "save" operation.

remarks.para: The IsSaveAs property returns true when the event was triggered by a call to the method, or by a call to the method when the document is new, or by a call to either method when the document is read-only. Otherwise, the IsSaveAs property returns false.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool PerformSaveOperation() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function PerformSaveOperation () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Performs the save operation requested by the user.
Docs.returns: true if the "save" or "save as" operation was successful; if the user cancels the operation by clicking Cancel in the Save As dialog box, returns false.

remarks.para: The PerformSaveOperation performs a "save" operation or a "save as" operation depending on the value of the property. If the operation is successful, the property is set to false.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.
